name: ARConfiguration
desc: The base object that contains information about how to configure an augmented reality session.

items.name: class var isSupported: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the current device supports this session configuration class.

items.name: var frameSemantics: ARConfiguration.FrameSemantics
items.desc: The set of active semantics on the frame.

items.name: struct ARConfiguration.FrameSemantics
items.desc: Types of optional frame features you can enable in your app.

items.name: class func supportsFrameSemantics(ARConfiguration.FrameSemantics) -> Bool
items.desc: Checks whether a particular feature is supported.

items.name: var isLightEstimationEnabled: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value specifying whether ARKit analyzes scene lighting in captured camera images.

items.name: var worldAlignment: ARConfiguration.WorldAlignment
items.desc: A value specifying how the session maps real-world device motion into a 3D scene coordinate system.

items.name: enum ARConfiguration.WorldAlignment
items.desc: Options for how ARKit constructs a scene coordinate system based on real-world device motion.

items.name: var videoFormat: ARConfiguration.VideoFormat
items.desc: A camera type, resolution, and frame rate for an AR session.

items.name: class var supportedVideoFormats: [ARConfiguration.VideoFormat]
items.desc: The set of video capture formats available on the current device.

items.name: class ARConfiguration.VideoFormat
items.desc: A video size and frame rate specification for use with an AR session.

items.name: var providesAudioData: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that specifies whether to capture audio during the AR session.

items.name: struct ARConfiguration.SceneReconstruction
items.desc: Options that enable ARKit to detect the shape of the physical environment.
